AU: NOGAMI, T; OTANI, J; KONAGAI, K; CHEN, HL
AF: NOGAMI, T; OTANI, J; KONAGAI, K; CHEN, HL
TI: NONLINEAR SOIL-PILE INTERACTION-MODEL FOR DYNAMIC LATERAL MOTION
ID: GROUPED PILES; RESPONSES
AB: A rational dynamic soil-pile interaction model is presented. The model is developed adopting Winkler's hypothesis with a special attention to the conditions in which the strong nonlinearity is induced in the vicinity of the pile shaft under dynamic loading. It is formulated in a simple system of frequency independent mass, springs, and dashpots. Therefore, the model enables us to conduct the time-domain nonlinear analysis in a relatively simple manner. Since the model can reproduce the dynamic effects by itself, its parameters are defined from the static behavior of a soil-pile system or reasonable p-y curves developed under the static condition. With a special consideration of a gap formed at the soil-pile interface, the proposed model and procedure to define its parameters have successfully predicted the dynamic pile response observed in the field dynamic pile load tests. The nonlinear condition and dynamic condition are coupled with each other to produce the complex soil action to the pile shaft motion.

AU: YAMAZAKI, M; SUZUKI, H; SUGIYAMA, Y; IGA, T; HANANO, M
AF: YAMAZAKI, M; SUZUKI, H; SUGIYAMA, Y; IGA, T; HANANO, M
TI: UPTAKE OF ORGANIC-ANIONS BY ISOLATED RAT HEPATOCYTES - A CLASSIFICATION IN TERMS OF ATP-DEPENDENCY
ID: ISOLATED LIVER-CELLS; BINDING-PROTEIN; PLASMA-MEMBRANE; SULFOBROMOPHTHALEIN-BINDING; HEPATIC-UPTAKE; TRANSPORT; BILIRUBIN
AB: Uptake of organic anions into isolated rat hepatocytes was studied to examine their ATP dependency. In the presence of rotenone (0.2-mu-M), the initial velocity of the uptake (V0) of dibromosulfophthalein (DBSP; 10-mu-M), 1-anilino-8-naphthalenesulfonate (ANS; 10-mu-M) and benzylpenicillin (PCG; 0.02-mu-M) was reduced to 60-70% of the control value, while that of bromosulfophthalein (BSP; 10-mu-M), rose bengal (RB; 10-mu-M) and bromophenol blue(BPB; 10-mu-M) was not affected. Furthermore, we examined the inhibitory effect of rotenone on the uptake at equilibrium of non-metabolizable ligands (DBSP, BPB and RB). The uptake of these ligands reached equilibrium at 30 min with a cel-to-medium concentration ratio (C/M ratio) of 75, 37 and 126, respectively. The C/M ratio at equilibrium of DBSP was reduced by rotenone to approx. 60% of the control value, while that of BPB and RB was not reduced. Other metabolic inhibitors such as sodium azide (10 mM) and carbonylcyanide-p-trifluoromethoxyphenylhydrazone (FCCP; 10-mu-M) also reduced the V0 of DBSP and PCG, while the uptake of BSP and RB was not reduced by these inhibitors. These results indicate that organic anions can be classified into two groups according to whether they are taken up by hepatocytes in an ATP-dependent manner, i.e., via active transport or in an ATP-independent manner, i.e., via facilitated diffusion. DBSP, PCG and ANS belong to the former group, whereas BSP, BPB and RB belong to the latter.

AU: YAMAZAKI, M; SUGIYAMA, Y; SUZUKI, H; IGA, T; HANANO, M
AF: YAMAZAKI, M; SUGIYAMA, Y; SUZUKI, H; IGA, T; HANANO, M
TI: UTILIZATION OF ATP-DEPLETED CELLS IN THE ANALYSIS OF TAUROCHOLATE UPTAKE BY ISOLATED RAT HEPATOCYTES
ID: PLASMA-MEMBRANE VESICLES; BILE-ACID TRANSPORT; LIVER-CELLS; INTRACELLULAR PH; CHOROID-PLEXUS; SODIUM; EXCHANGE; MECHANISM; CHLORIDE; CARRIER
AB: The usefulness of ATP-depleted rat hepatocytes in transport studies was examined. ATP-depleted hepatocytes were prepared by incubating cell suspensions with 30-mu-M rotenone. In ATP-depleted hepatocytes, plasma membrane permeability was increased and mitochondrial membrane potential decreased, while both intracellular volume and pH remained normal. Furthermore, in the presence of valinomycin, the initial uptake rates of H-3-tetraphenyl phosphonium (TPP+) with varied medium concentrations of potassium were predicted according to the Goldman-Hodgkin-Katz equation, which demonstrated that a potassium diffusion potential could be produced in this system. Using the thus-characterized ATP-depleted cells, the uptake mechanism of taurocholate was investigated. In the presence of an inwardly directed Na gradient, the taurocholate uptake was markedly stimulated and bile acid was transiently accumulated at a concentration 3-times higher than at equilibrium ('overshoot') in ATP-depleted cells. No overshoot was observed in viable cells, however, which suggests that in ATP-depleted cells the Na gradient, a driving force for taurocholate uptake, decreased with time. In both viable and ATP-depleted cells, the relationship between medium concentrations of Na and the Na-dependent initial uptake rate were sigmoidal, and the Hill coefficients were close to 2. The Na-dependent initial uptake rate of taurocholate was stimulated by a valinomycin-induced inside negative potassium-diffusion potential in ATP-depleted cells, and the movement of a 'one plus' (as a net) charge was revealed by fitting the data to the Goldman-Hodgkin-Katz equation. These results support the hypothesis that sodium-coupled hepatic uptake of taurocholate occuthrough an electrogenic process with the stoichiometry of 2 Na: 1 taurocholate, although this issue is controversial. In the presence of an outwardly directed sodium gradient, efflux of taurocholate from ATP-depleted cells was not stimulated. Consequently, the physiological transport vector of taurocholate from blood to cell is not only due to the direction of the sodium gradient (blood to cell) but also to membraneous orientation of transport carriers. In conclusion, kinetic analysis using ATP-depleted hepatocytes allowed the formulation of a new approach to clarify the as yet unresolved issues concerning transport stoichiometry and the mechanism for vectorial transport of taurocholate.

AB: Workers in a long-term relationship often have an incentive to hide their ability early in the relationship to avoid having the firm increase the level of output expected from them in the future. We show that competition for older workers will permit the implementation of efficient piece-rate contracts. When the difficulty of the job is unobserved by the firm, Gibbons (1987) has shown that all piece-rate contracts will be inefficient. Together, these results may explain why piece rates are common in some jobs, such as agricultural work and sales, and not as popular for many manufacturing jobs.

SO: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
ID: ELECTRONIC STATE; MNAS
AB: Magnon and phonon dispersion relations in a ferromagnet MnSb of NiAs-type crystal structure are measured using neutron spectroscopy. The results are compared with the recent calculation of magnon dispersion based on the spin fluctuation theory. The magnitude of the exchange interaction between neighboring magnetic atoms is obtained as the ratio of the interaction. Phonon dispersion of MnSb shows that there is tendency of the crystal transformation to MnP-type structure.

AU: INABA, M; MIYAYAMA, M; YANAGIDA, H
AF: INABA, M; MIYAYAMA, M; YANAGIDA, H
TI: INFRARED SENSING PROPERTIES OF POSITIVE TEMPERATURE-COEFFICIENT THERMISTORS WITH LARGE TEMPERATURE COEFFICIENTS OF RESISTIVITY
AB: Infrared (IR) detecting elements were prepared using positive temperature coefficient (PTC) thermistors with large temperature coefficients of resistivity (alpha). Their compositions were denoted as Ba1-xSrxNb0.003Ti0.997O3 + 1 mol % TiO2 + 0.07 mol % MnO (x = 0, 0.2), and their temperature coefficients of resistivity were 78 and 50 % K- 1, respectively. Their IR sensing properties were measured under the self-regulating heating conditions, and were compared with those of a detector with small alpha (18% K-1). It was shown that large alpha was effective for controlling the element temperature by self-regulating heating and for improving sensitivity. The responsivity, R(v), of the element with x = 0.2 was 980 VW-1, and was as large as those of pyroelectric detectors. Expressions which normalize the sensitivity and the thermal time constant were derived. From these expressions, criteria for improving some IR sensing properties were obtained.

AU: DHARMAPPA, HB; VERINK, J; BENAIM, R; YAMAMOTO, K; VIGNESWARAN, S
AF: DHARMAPPA, HB; VERINK, J; BENAIM, R; YAMAMOTO, K; VIGNESWARAN, S
TI: A COMPREHENSIVE MODEL FOR CROSS-FLOW FILTRATION INCORPORATING POLYDISPERSITY OF THE INFLUENT
DE: FOULING; MICROFILTRATION; THEORY; ULTRAFILTRATION; WATER TREATMENT; POLYDISPERSITY
ID: MEMBRANES
AB: A semi-empirical model is presented for the prediction of foulant deposit thickness and concentration, and thereby, predicting the permeate flux in cross-flow microfiltration and ultrafiltration. The scope of the model is limited to colloidal suspensions (i.e. non-diffusive solutes) and its hallmark is its applicability to polydispersed influents. The theoretical model was verified with experimental observations and found to yield a fairly good agreement with an error less than 62% of the average flux over 100 min of filtration. However, evaluation of model coefficients a and b is necessary through laboratory studies. The model was successfully used to predict the effect of particle size distribution (PSD) on permeate flux. The simulation results corroborate the contention that the long-term flux decline is due to the reduction in foulant deposit permeability via infiltration of fines into the cake, thereby demonstrating the importance of influent particle size distribution (PSD) on foulant deposit permeability. The proposed model is a first step towards the modeling of polydispersed influents. As such there is a lot of scope for further refinements which is briefly discussed.

CT: 7TH INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON HALIDE GLASSES
SP: MONASH UNIV, CTR ADV MAT TECHNOL, TELECOMMUN AUSTR RES LABS MONTECH
AB: The structure of a ternary 40AlF3.20YF3.40CaF2 glass (AYC glass) was examined by a combination of X-ray and neutron diffraction analysis and molecular dynamics simulations. The comparison with the structure of 40AlF3.20BaF2.40CaF2 glass (ABC glass) [T. Nanba et al., Mater. Sci. Forum 32&33 (1988) 385] indicated that the network structures of both glasses were similar to each other, with AlF6 octahedra joining at their corners to form chains with branches. Although AlF7 polyhedra were not found in ABC glass, they existed in AYC glass, as one third of the AlF6 octahedra, and these polyhedra were distorted due to the presence of Y3+ ions.

CT: 7TH INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON HALIDE GLASSES
SP: MONASH UNIV, CTR ADV MAT TECHNOL, TELECOMMUN AUSTR RES LABS MONTECH
AB: Two types of glasses in the ternary AlF3-BaF2-CaF2 system were prepared under different cooling rates to investigate their network structure. It is suggested that the network is constructed from (AlF5)2- chains and (AlF6)3- isolated units and many isolated units are present in the rapidly cooled glass from radial distribution analyses. Molecular dynamics simulations were carried out to reproduce the difference in the glass network. The models showed good agreement with the observed RDF and Raman spectrum, but an exact structural difference in the network could not be obtained. However, it is suggested that chains with branches may be formed when the melt is slowly cooled.

AU: KONASHI, K; YAMAWAKI, M
AF: KONASHI, K; YAMAWAKI, M
TI: EVALUATION OF IODINE PRESSURE IN OXIDE FUEL-PINS UNDER IRRADIATION
SO: JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY
DE: CHEMICAL BEHAVIOR; FISSION PRODUCTS; IODINE; CESIUM IODIDE; FUEL PINS; RADIOLYSIS
ID: REACTORS
AB: This review summarizes the published theoretical and experimental studies of CsI radiolysis in an operating fuel pin. The calculation method, which has been developed based on gas kinetic theory, is effective for the evaluation of the radiation effect on iodine pressure. The iodine partial pressures, which were calculated by the above method, are high enough to cause FCCI in FBR fuel pins and SCC in LWR fuel rods. The literature data of experiments exhibit that the iodine is liberated through gamma-radiolysis of solid CsI, and the CsI vapor irradiated by electron beam also produced high iodine pressures. It has been also confirmed that the radiation effect in gas phase is still significant even in the case of existence of Cs pressure, which causes decrease of the iodine pressure by recombination. This review concludes that the radiation effect is important for understanding the chemical behavior of iodine in operating fuel pins.

TI: IRON EXTRACTION EFFICACY OF PLANT BORNE MUGINEIC ACID FAMILY PHYTOSIDEROPHORES IN INDIAN CALCAREOUS SOILS
CT: 6TH INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON IRON
SP: UTAH STATE AGR EXPT STN, BIONATL AGR RES & DEV FUND
ID: DIFFERENT STRATEGIES; CHELATING ACTIVITY; METAL-COMPLEXES; MOBILIZATION; RELEASE; BARLEY; ROOTS; MICRONUTRIENTS; ACQUISITION; ZINC
AB: An experiment with different chelators involving plant made mugineic acid (MA), deferrioxamine B (FOB) and DTPA along with deionized water as a control was performed to evaluate the Fe extraction ability of the chelators from Indian calcareous soils having high pH, low Fe content, and rich in calcium carbonate. MA manifested the highest Fe extraction efficiency in all the calcareous soils. On the contrary, other chelators displayed rather poor activity of Fe extraction. MA also mobilized Cu, Zn, Mn, Ca, and Mg. However, DTPA solubilized Ca more efficiently than MA. Different calcareous soils also varied with respect to Fe extraction ability. In a green house experiment, Indian barley cultivar (cv) NDB-209 under calcareous soils, however, exhibited very low Fe solubility in the soil rhizosphere indicating the possibility of simultaneous and periodical release and high Fe(III)-MAs uptake rate by the plants in quick succession to optimize Fe acquisition efficiency and minimize the microbial decomposition of spontaneous mugineic acid family phytosiderophores (MAs).

AB: For the purpose of gene cloning for HAs-synthesis or Fe(III)-MAs transporter a partial derivative gt10 cDNA library was constructed from mRNA isolated from Fe-deficient barley roots. The library was then differentially screened between cDNA probes made from mRNA isolated from barley roots treated with +Fe and -Fe. Seven clones which hybridized specifically to the probe of Fe-deficiency were selected. Their inserts however were too short and not likely to include full length of mRNA. On the basis of these results we decided to screen a newly constructed partial derivative zapII cDNA library with one of the seven clones as a probe and selected a clone presumably having the full length of mRNA compared with northern hybridization. We named this cone as Ids1. The sequenced Ids1 consists of 503 nucleotides containing a putative open reading frame of 222 bp. It encodes a protein of 74 residues (7500 Da) having two cysteine rich domains like animal

TI: STUDY OF SOLID-STATE POLYMERIZATION BY POSITRON LIFETIME MEASUREMENTS
SO: JOURNAL OF POLYMER SCIENCE PART B-POLYMER PHYSICS
DE: POLYMERIZATION, SOLID-STATE, POSITRON LIFETIME TECHNIQUE FOR STUDY OF; ACRYLAMIDE, POSITRON LIFETIME STUDY OF; ACRYLAMIDE, SOLID-STATE POLYMERIZATION OF
ID: ANNIHILATION TECHNIQUES
AB: The positron lifetime measurement technique was applied to analyze the structural changes Occurring in solid-state polymerization of acrylamide and trioxane. Positronium (Ps) parameters, tau(2) and I(2), which show a marked change as a function of the gamma-ray irradiation dose, signaled the presence of three clearly defined stages in the polymerization process: initiation, propagation, and saturation. The initial increase in tau(2), may very well be the result of efficient trapping of Ps in vacancies created around the polymer nuclei. The complicated behavior of I(2) may be explained as a chemical reaction between Ps precursors and the radiolysis products of this polymerization process.

AU: SASOH, A; ARAKAWA, Y
AF: SASOH, A; ARAKAWA, Y
TI: ELECTROMAGNETIC EFFECTS IN AN APPLIED-FIELD MAGNETOPLASMADYNAMIC THRUSTER
AB: Experimental and analytical studies have been conducted on the performance and thrust production mechanisms of an applied-field magnetoplasmadynamic thruster. The thruster was able to run with a high-thruster performance due to large electromagnetic effects related to the applied magnetic field. Using hydrogen, helium, and argon as the propellant, over 20% thrust efficiency was obtained over a wide specific impulse range from 1000 to 7000 s at input power levels between 2.2 and 15.9 kW. From the measurements of performance characteristics and current densities in the acceleration region, and by a theoretical analysis, it is found that the thruster operation is characterized by a parameter, B2/m (B: applied magnetic field strength, m: propellant mass flow rate).

AU: HATAMURA, Y; HANAMOTO, T
AF: HATAMURA, Y; HANAMOTO, T
TI: DEVELOPMENT OF A 3-DIRECTIONAL STRESS CELL AND MEASUREMENT OF STRESS-DISTRIBUTION ON A BACKHOE BUCKET
CT: 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF OF THE INTERNATIONAL SOC FOR TERRAIN-VEHICLE SYSTEMS
SP: INT SOC TERRAIN VEHICLE SYST
AB: In order to solve the problems between soil and construction machinery such as a hydraulic excavator, it is important to understand their mechanism. The purpose of this research is the development of a three-directional stress cell to measure stress distribution on a backhoe bucket to understand the mechanism of excavation. This three-directional stress cell can directly measure three-directional stresses simultaneously and has both strong structure and high sensitivity, which is not changed by the abrasion of the detecting plate. By using these cells, three-directional stress distribution on the bucket during excavation is measured. The results of the excavation experiments have given us the most fundamental theory of soil excavation, some hints to solve the problems between soil and construction machinery, and a future image of intelligent construction machinery with intelligent sensors.

TI: MECHANOCHEMICAL POLISHING OF SILICON-CARBIDE SINGLE-CRYSTAL WITH CHROMIUM(III) OXIDE ABRASIVE
SO: JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CERAMIC SOCIETY
DE: SILICON CARBIDE; POLISHING; CHROMIA; OXIDATION; CATALYSIS
ID: EXCESS OXYGEN; CHROMIA; LAYERS; DEPOSITION; OXIDATION; SURFACE; ALLOYS; GROWTH
AB: In order to clarify the mechanism of mechanochemical polishing of SiC with Cr2O3 abrasive, 6H-wurtzite single-crystal specimens were dry-polished. A significant anisotropic polishing rate difference was found between Si(0001) and C(0001BAR) surfaces. The C(0001BAR) surface was removed 10 times as fast. Polished surfaces were observed from cross-sectional and plan-view directions by high-voltage TEM. There was no trace of mechanical effects such as residual strain or scratches. The polishing debris was analyzed by X-ray diffraction, high-resolution TEM, and analytical TEM. No crystalline phases were identified from X-ray diffraction patterns except for Cr2O3, while it was found from TEM observation that a large amount of an amorphous phase consisting of Si, C, and O was contained in the debris. These results indicated that the surface of SiC was removed mechanochemically by the aid of a catalytic oxidation effect of Cr2O3.

TI: MAGNETOTRANSPORT PHENOMENA OF ALPHA-TYPE (BEDT-TTF)2I3 UNDER HIGH-PRESSURES
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
ID: DIMENSIONAL ORGANIC METAL; MAGNETORESISTANCE; SUPERCONDUCTORS; THETA-(BEDT-TTF)2I3; ALPHA-(BEDT-TTF)2I3; BETA-(BEDT-TTF)2I3; CONDUCTORS
AB: The magnetotransport phenomenon is investigated in alpha-lype crystals of (BEDT-TTF)2I3 which are metallized by applying quasi-hydrostatic pressures. At liquid helium temperatures, a fairly large magnetoresistance which rises in very low field and saturates above 0.5 T is observed. The effect of the magnetic field of 1,2 T is found to be recognizable at temperatures above 50 K. Our interpretation of the phenomenon is that the metal-insulator transition which has been suppressed by the pressure arises again, aided by the magnetic field.

SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
ID: SPECTRUM
AB: Correlation functions of real symmetric random matrix ensembles are expressed by corresponding skew orthogonal polynomials. The skew orthogonal polynomials related to classical orthogonal polynomials are presented in a compact way and the correlation functions in the thermodynamic limit are exactly evaluated in several special cases. The local correlation functions in these cases are identical to those of the Gaussian ensemble.

SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
AB: A model calculation of the Hall factor for a metallic system with a small Fermi energy has revealed that it can lead to a significant temperature dependence of Hall coefficient even when a single parabolic band contributes to electrical conduction. The present result gives a natural explanation for the behavior of temperature dependence of the transport properties observed in GaAs/AlxGa1-xAs superlattices.

AU: TAKADA, Y
AF: TAKADA, Y
TI: PLASMON MECHANISM OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY IN THE MULTIVALLEY ELECTRON-GAS
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
AB: The Eliashberg equation is solved in both frequency and momentum variables to obtain the superconducting transition temperature T(c) in the multivalley electron gas without phonons. Both the one-particle Green's function and irreducible two-electron interaction are evaluated in the random-phase approximation which provides exact results in the limit of large valley degeneracy g(v) and is known to give sufficiently accurate ones even for g(v) as small as 3 or 4. Among s-, p-, and d-waves, the s-wave pairing is most stable for g(v) greater-than-or-equal-to 2 with a fairly high tau(c). For g(v) >> 1, our solution is reduced to "bipolaronic superconductivity". We discuss implications of the present results to the exotic superconductors with relatively low carrier concentration.

AU: AKINAGA, H; TAKITA, K; TAKEYAMA, S; MIURA, N
AF: AKINAGA, H; TAKITA, K; TAKEYAMA, S; MIURA, N
TI: MN2+ INTERNAL EMISSION AND EXCITONIC EMISSION OF MBE-GROWN CD1-XMNXTE - DEPENDENCE ON SUBSTRATE-TEMPERATURE AND MAGNETIC-FIELD
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
ID: PHOTO-LUMINESCENCE BANDS; OPTICAL-TRANSITION; CDTE-FILMS; SEMICONDUCTORS; PHOTOLUMINESCENCE; EXCITATION; (CD,MN)TE; POLARONS; SPECTRA; ENERGY
AB: It has been reported that there exists Mn-related photoluminescence at 2.0 eV in addition to excitonic emission in Cd1-xMnxTe with x more than 0.3 grown by conventional methods. We have investigated dependence of these luminescence lines on substrate temperature, T5, in MBE-grown Cd0.6Mn0.4Te crystals. A large broad line was observed at around 2.05 eV in samples grown at high T5 at about 400-degrees-C whereas a sharp line at around 2.17 eV evolved in samples grown at T5 = 320-340-degrees-C. Both of these lines were seen in the case of T5 = 380-degrees-C. Measurement of the magnetic field dependence of the peak positions up to 40 T revealed that the former assigned as Mn related luminescence shows no observable %ccman shift. On the other hand, the later is assigned as the excitonic emission because of the large shift to lower energy in the magnetic field. The experimental results suggest that the Mn-related photoluminescence at 2.0 eV is affected strongly by crystal imperfections, probably the vacancy type defects. On the basis of these results, a possible optical processes of the Mn related luminescence are discussed.
C1: UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 106,JAPAN

SO: JOURNAL OF TRAUMA-INJURY INFECTION AND CRITICAL CARE
AB: Coronal fracture of the body of the hamate with associated dorsal subluxation of the bases of the fourth and fifth metacarpals is rare. Two cases of this injury with and without disruption of the dorsal carpometacarpal ligaments treated with open reduction and internal fixation are reported. Oblique roentgenographic views with the hand pronated 30-degrees from the true lateral were helpful in the assessment of the fracture.

ID: HOMONUCLEAR CROSS POLARIZATION; STRUCTURAL-CHANGES; SPECTROSCOPY; ETHERS; BONDS
AB: Structures of acetylated residual lignin obtained from unbleached beech kraft pulp were investigated by 2D NMR in combination with selective cleavage of non-phenolic alpha-alkyl ether bonds with pivaloyl iodide generated in situ from pivaloyl chloride / sodium sodium iodide. Beta-O-4 and resinol structures still remained in this polymer lignin. Furthermore, carbohydrates were proved to be linked glycosidically to benzyl carbons of lignin. Possibly this inhibits complete delignification during kraft pulping.

AU: NOSAKA, K; NAKADA, J; ENDOU, H
AF: NOSAKA, K; NAKADA, J; ENDOU, H
TI: CISPLATIN-INDUCED ALTERATIONS IN RENAL STRUCTURE, AMMONIAGENESIS AND GLUCONEOGENESIS OF RATS
ID: CHRONIC METABOLIC-ACIDOSIS; ACUTE TUBULAR NECROSIS; INTER-NEPHRON HETEROGENEITY; PLATINUM NEPHROTOXICITY; POTASSIUM-DEPLETION; INTRA-NEPHRON; FAILURE; TRANSPEPTIDASE; REGENERATION; GLUTAMINASE
AB: Cisplatin [cis-diamminedichloroplatinum (II): CDDP] is a widely used cancer chemotherapeutic agent which has been shown to cause dose-related acute renal failure. The kidney damage is histologically characterized by widespread tubular necrosis, predominantly found in the third segments (S3) of the proximal tubules. To identify the intranephron targets of CDDP more precisely, we examined alterations in ammoniagenesis (AMG) and gluconeogenesis (GLG) using rat kidney slices (for AMG and GLG), tubule suspensions (for GLG), and microdissected nephron segments (for AMG). Ultramicroassay of AMG was carried out using the enzymatic cycling method, and GLG was measured by the HK/G6PHD method. GLG obtained from kidney slices and tubule suspensions on day 3 and day 7 following CDDP treatment did not change significantly from levels in control rats. In contrast, AMG increased on day 3 in the first and third kidney slices cut from the surface inward and decreased significantly on day 7 in the third and fourth slices. Microdissected nephron segments examined on day 7 showed decreased AMG in the second segments (S2; 20.3 +/- 7.7 pmol/mm/15 min vs. 78.7 +/- 9.7 for control, P < 0.005) and the third segments (S3; 26.3 +/- 14.4 pmol/mm/15 min vs. 79.2 +/- 7.8 for control, P < 0.005) of the proximal tubules. Additionally, we observed morphological changes under light microscopy to examine the relationship between metabolism and morphology. On day 3 following the CDDP treatment, typical acute tubular necrosis was seen primarily localized in the outer stripe of the outer medulla, while on day 7 the lesion appeared to be recovering. Our data imply a prominent dissociation between renal metabolic and morphologic changes induced by CDDP. First, AMG in a distinct part of the kidney was enhanced on day 3, suggesting a compensatory hyperfunction of AMG in the early proximal tubule (S1) or thick ascending limb of Henle (TAL), at a time when morphological damage was approaching maximum. Second, AMG in both S2 and S3 was significantly reduced on day 7 possibly because of a high demand for amino acids for protein synthesis during tubular epithelial regeneration.

TI: SYNTHESIS AND PROPERTIES OF POLYDIMETHYLSILOXANE POLYIMIDE BLOCK COPOLYMERS BY SILYLATED DIAMINE METHOD
DE: POLYDIMETHYLSILOXANE POLYIMIDE BLOCK COPOLYMERS; SILYLATED DIAMINE METHOD; SOLUBILITY; THERMAL BEHAVIOR; TENSILE PROPERTIES
ID: CARBOXYL-TERMINATED POLYDIMETHYLSILOXANE; AROMATIC POLYAMIDES; MULTIBLOCK COPOLYMERS; DIISOCYANATE METHOD; POLYBUTADIENE; POLY(DIMETHYLSILOXANE); COPOLYIMIDES; BEHAVIOR
AB: Starting from telechelic amine-terminated polydimethylsiloxane (PDMS) oligomers (PDMS-diamines), PDMS-polyimide block copolymers were synthesized by the silylated diamine method. The polymerization of the N-trimethylsilyl-substituted PDMS-diamine, N-trimethylsilylated bis(4-aminophenyl) ether, and pyromellitic dianhydride in diglyme at room temperature afforded the PDMS-polyamic acid trimethylsilyl ester block copolymers. The PDMS-polyimide block copolymer films were obtained by casting the diglyme solutions followed by heating at 300-degrees-C. The PDMS-polyimide block copolymers did not decompose below 300-degrees-C, and behaved as high temperature resistant elastomers.

AF: MATSUYAMA, K; URYU, T
TI: REGULATED BULK-POLYMERIZATION OF STYRENE BY ESTER GROUP-CONTAINING PEROXIDES AND THE SIMULATION
DE: BULK POLYMERIZATION; STYRENE; ESTER GROUP-CONTAINING PEROXIDE; KINETIC; SIMULATION; PRIMARY RADICAL TERMINATION; HYDROGEN ATOM ABSTRACTION
ID: FREE-RADICAL POLYMERIZATION
AB: Bulk polymerization of styrene was carried out at 100-degrees-C using initiators of ester group-containing peroxides such as t-butylperoxy benzoate, t-butylperoxy isopropyl carbonate, and t-butylperoxy phenyl carbonate which had approximately equal decomposition temperatures, and analyzed by the kinetic method and the simulation to high conversion. The behavior of the polymerization was influenced significantly by the kind of primary radicals with various reactivities. Particularly, the hydrogen atom abstraction from the polymer by the alkoxy radicals and the primary radical termination by stable phenoxy radicals influenced greatly the rates and the molecular weight of the polymer formed in the latter half stage.

AU: HAYASHI, T; WATANABE, A; TANAKA, H; NISHI, T
AF: HAYASHI, T; WATANABE, A; TANAKA, H; NISHI, T
TI: MORPHOLOGY AND PHYSICAL-PROPERTIES OF 3 COMPONENT INCOMPATIBLE POLYMER ALLOYS
DE: DIGITAL IMAGE ANALYSIS; MORPHOLOGY; ELECTRON MICROGRAPH; NYLON 6,6-POLY(PHENYLENE OXIDE)-RUBBER; IZOD IMPACT STRENGTH; TENSILE STRENGTH; TENSILE ELONGATION; BENDING STRENGTH; BENDING MODULUS; HEAT DISTORTION TEMPERATURE
ID: DIGITAL IMAGE-ANALYSIS
AB: In this research, we have applied a digital image analysis method to study morphology of polymer alloys quantitatively. We developed several techniques to analyze the morphology of polymer alloys. As an example, we chose Nylon 6,6/poly(phenylene oxide)/rubber alloy. The morphology was observed with electron microscopy. We developed some new methods to estimate the randomness and the degree of clustering for particle patterns. We also analyzed the regularity of the morphology using the concepts of informational entropy. We could find some clear relationships between the parameters of the morphology analyzed with digital image analysis and the physical properties such as Izod impact strength, tensile strength, tensile elongation, bending strength, bending modulus and heat distortion temperature. We have also studied the mechanism of toughening based on digital image analysis results.

TI: THERMAL AND MECHANICAL-PROPERTIES OF POLYDIMETHYLSILOXANE POLYAMIDE MULTIBLOCK COPOLYMERS
DE: POLYDIMETHYLSILOXANE POLYAMIDE MULTIBLOCK COPOLYMERS; STRUCTURE PROPERTY RELATIONSHIP; THERMAL BEHAVIOR; TENSILE PROPERTIES; DYNAMIC MECHANICAL PROPERTIES
ID: SEGMENTED ORGANOSILOXANE COPOLYMERS; SILOXANE UREA COPOLYMERS; AROMATIC POLYAMIDES; TERMINATED POLYDIMETHYLSILOXANE; CO-POLYMERS; POLYBUTADIENE
AB: The structure-property relationships in polydimethylsiloxane (PDMS)-polyamide multiblock copolymers were studied by means of static and dynamic thermal analysis and tensile test. The materials used were four kinds of multiblock copolymers composed of alpha,omega-bis(3-aminopropyl)polydimethylsiloxane as the soft component, and the polyamides as the hard component derived from combinations of trans-2,5-dimethylpiperazine and two oxydianilines, and isophthaloyl and terephthaloyl chlorides. The solubility was very similar to that of the parent polyamides. These multiblock copolymers had glass transition temperatures of PDMS phase around -120-degrees-C, indicative of microphase separated structures of the multiblock copolymers. Changing the hard segment from the flexible piperazine-containing polyamides to the rigid oxydianiline-based polyamides gave the multiblock copolymers with better-defined microphase separated structures.

TI: CAPILLARY WAVE-PROPAGATION ON WATER COVERED WITH INHOMOGENEOUS MONOLAYERS - LIQUID GAS COEXISTENCE FILMS
ID: PHASE-TRANSITIONS; 2-DIMENSIONAL GAS; AIR WATER; SHAPES
AB: Externally generated capillary wave propagation has been studied on water whose surface was covered with a monolayer in the liquid/gas coexistence phase up to 1 kHz. A simultaneous morphology observation with a fluorescence microscope enabled us to make a one-to-one correspondence between the fraction of the liquid film and the propagation characteristics. It was found that the liquid film does not affect the capillary wave significantly until it covers more than 90% of the water surface, which indicates that the dynamic elasticity of the liquid monolayer below 1 kHz is extremely low. It was also noted that the bubbles (the gas phase) were very stable against coalescence, implying that the line tension of the liquid phase is quite low. These findings suggest that the liquid phase in equilibrium with the gas phase is in a very shallow intermolecular potential. It was confirmed that the surface waves do not affect the morphology of the monolayer.

AU: MATSUMOTO, T
AF: MATSUMOTO, T
TI: COMPETITIVE ANALYSIS OF THE ROUND-ROBIN ALGORITHM
AB: We investigate on-line algorithms that schedule preemptive tasks on single processor machines when the arrival time of a task is not known in advance and the length of a task is unknown until its termination. The goal is to minimize the sum of the waiting times over all tasks. We formulate an on-line algorithm, RR, which is an ideal version of so-called Round Robin algorithm. It is known that, if all tanks arrive at one time, RR is 2-competitive [W]. We prove that, when tasks may arrive at different times, the competitve ratio of RR is between 2(k-1)/H(k-1) and 2(k-1), where k is the maximal number of tasks that can exist at any given time. Our analysis also yields bounds on the sum of response times, and through several criteria we demonstrate the effectiveness of Round Robin algorithm.

AU: SUGIHARA, K
AF: SUGIHARA, K
TI: TOPOLOGICALLY CONSISTENT ALGORITHMS RELATED TO CONVEX POLYHEDRA
ID: DIAGRAMS
AB: The paper presents a general method for the design of numerically robust and topologically consistent geometric algorithms concerning convex polyhedra in the three-dimensional space. A graph is the vertex-edge graph of a convex polyhedron if and only if it is planar and triply connected (Steinitz' theorem). On the basis of this theorem, conventional geometric algorithms are revised in such a way that, no matter how poor the precision in numerical computation may be, the output graph is at least planar and triply connected. The resultant algorithms are robust in the sense that they do not fail in finite-precision arithmetic, and are consistent in the sense that the output is the true solution to a perturbed input.

AU: IRI, M
AF: IRI, M
TI: HOW TO GENERATE REALISTIC SAMPLE PROBLEMS FOR NETWORK OPTIMIZATION
AB: Experimental tests are probably the most direct way of evaluating the performance of computer algorithms and of appealing to their users. However, there seems to be no apparent agreement regarding how to generate sample problems for the test. Commonly used random generation, for example, has several problems since that solely produces those instances which follow truly even distribution and then which do not look like 'real' samples we actually encounter in the world of actuality. In this paper, we discuss what kind of properties are significant for proper generation of sample problems from a practical-mathematical point of view. Our attention is focussed mainly on the network optimization problems.

AU: HAKATA, K; IMAI, H
AF: HAKATA, K; IMAI, H
TI: THE LONGEST COMMON SUBSEQUENCE PROBLEM FOR SMALL ALPHABET SIZE BETWEEN MANY STRINGS
ID: ALGORITHM
AB: Given two or more strings (for example, DNA and amino acid sequences), the longest common subsequence (LCS) problem is to determine the longest common subsequence obtained by deleting zero or more symbols from each string. The algorithms for computing an LCS between two strings were given by many papers, but there is no efficient algorithm for computing an LCS between more than two strings. This paper proposes a method for computing efficiently the LCS between three or more strings of small alphabet size. Specifically, our algorithm computes the LCS of d(greater-than-or-equal-to 3) strings of length n on alphabet of size s in O(nsd + Dsd(log(d-3) n + log(d-2) s)) time, where D is the number of dominant matches and is much smaller than n(d). Through computational experiments, we demonstrate the effectiveness of our algorithm.

AU: MATSUOKA, S; WATANABE, T; ICHISUGI, Y; YONEZAWA, A
AF: MATSUOKA, S; WATANABE, T; ICHISUGI, Y; YONEZAWA, A
TI: OBJECT-ORIENTED CONCURRENT REFLECTIVE ARCHITECTURES
AB: Reflection provides the abilities to reason and alter the dynamic behavior of comPutation from within the language framework. It is a practical scheme that offers a new perspective in constructing a malleable, large-scale system such as programming languages, operating systems, and window systems. Reflection is more beneficial in object-oriented concurrent/distributed computing, where the complexity of the system is much greater compared to sequential computing; this has been demonstrated through recent works in Object-Oriented Concurrent Reflective (OOCR) architectures. From a structural perspective, we can categorize OOCR architectures into individual-based, group-wide, and their hybrid (hybrid group). Through the introductive categorization of various OOCR architectures based on our previous and current work, we explore the characteristics as well as benefits and limitations of each.

AF: HIDAKA, Y; KOIKE, H; TANAKA, H
TI: ARCHITECTURE OF PARALLEL MANAGEMENT KERNEL FOR PIE64
AB: This paper describes the architecture of the parallel management kernel for the parallel inference engine PIE64, focusing on how to treat load distribution and scheduling in highly parallel symbolic processing The kernel manages automatic load distribution and scheduling. The remaining task for a programmer is to employ parallel algorithms with sufficient concurrency. A programmer need not be concerned with load distribution, load partitioning, load assignment, parallelism explosion, exhaustion of resources, or execution efficiency. The paper also describes an evaluation of the load distribution method.

AU: KUNIYOSHI, Y; INOUE, H
AF: KUNIYOSHI, Y; INOUE, H
TI: INDEXICALITY AND DYNAMIC ATTENTION CONTROL IN QUALITATIVE RECOGNITION OF ASSEMBLY ACTIONS
AB: Visual recognition of physical actions requires temporal segmentation and identification of action types. Action concepts are analyzed into attention, context, and change. Temporal segmentation is defined as a context switch detected by a switching of attention. Actions are identified by detecting ''indexical'' features which can be quickly calculated from visual features and directly point to action concepts. Validity of the indexicality depends on the attention and the context. These are maintained by three types of attention control: spatial, temporal and hierarchical. They are combined by a mechanism called 'attention stack'', which extends at important points and winds up elsewhere. An action recognizer built upon the framework successfully recognized human assembly action sequences in real time and output qualitative descriptions of the tasks.

AU: SUGIHARA, K
AF: SUGIHARA, K
TI: APPLICATION OF THE DELAUNAY TRIANGULATION TO GEOMETRIC INTERSECTION PROBLEMS
SO: LECTURE NOTES IN CONTROL AND INFORMATION SCIENCES
CT: 5TH CONF ON SYSTEM MODELLING AND OPTIMIZATION
SP: INT FEDERAT INFORMAT PROC
ID: ALGORITHMS
AB: The paper presents a new robust method for finding intersections of line segments in the plane. This method first constructs the Delaunay triangulation spanning the end points of line segments, and next recursively inserts the midpoints in the line segments that are not realized by Delaunay edges, until the descendants of the line segments become realized by Delaunay edges or the areas containing points of intersection are sufficiently localized. The method is robust in the sense that in any imprecise arithmetic it gives a topologically consistent arrangement as the output, and is stable in the sense that it does not miss intersections that can be easily detected by naive pairwise check with the precision at hand.

AB: Presented is a general theory to construct link polynomials, topological invariants for knots and links, from exactly solvable (integrable) models. TI: SUPPRESSION OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF UTERINE ADENOMYOSIS BY DANAZOL TREATMENT IN MICE
ID: FOLLOW-UP; PITUITARY; ENDOMETRIOSIS; THERAPY; INVITRO
AB: Inhibitory effects of danazol, an isoxazol derivative of synthetic Steroid 17-alpha-ethinyl-testosterone, on the development of uterine adenomyosis, a pathological disorder of endometrial tissue defined as the presence of endometrial glands and stroma in the myometrium, were investigated in mice of SHN strain. Mice treated with 0.5-mu-g danazol for 5 weeks during 4-9 weeks of age and killed at 21 weeks of age showed significantly lower incidence of the spontaneous development of adenomyosis than the age-matched intact control mice. The inhibitory effects of danazol were also evident in mice bearing pituitary isografts which were effective in inducing an early and a high incidence of adenomyosis. Furthermore, the treatment with danazol resulted in the decrease of serum levels of luteinizing hormone (LH) and prolactin (PRL) associated with hypofunction of ovaries and persistent diestrus. These results support the usefulness of danazol for the clinical treatment of gynecological disorders except for hypofunction of ovaries.

AF: TSUJI, A; TERASAKI, T; TAKABATAKE, Y; TENDA, Y; TAMAI, I; YAMASHIMA, T; MORITANI, S; TSURUO, T; YAMASHITA, J
TI: P-GLYCOPROTEIN AS THE DRUG EFFLUX PUMP IN PRIMARY CULTURED BOVINE BRAIN CAPILLARY ENDOTHELIAL-CELLS
ID: MULTIDRUG-RESISTANT CELLS; TRANSPORT; BARRIER; VINCRISTINE; PERMEABILITY; VINBLASTINE; METABOLISM; BINDING; DAUNORUBICIN; LOCALIZATION
AB: The expression of a functional P-glycoprotein (P-gp) which pumps drugs out of brain capillary endothelial cells (BCEC) into blood was studied by evaluating the steady-state uptake and efflux of vincristine (VCR) by primary cultured bovine BCEC. The steady-state uptake of VCR was increased in the presence of metabolic inhibitors, and an anti-P-gp monoclonal antibody, MRK16, as well as verapamil and steroid hormones which are known to reverse multidrug resistance in tumor cells. Furthermore, efflux of VCR from BCEC was inhibited by verapamil. By immunohistochemistry, P-gp was localized at the luminal side of the capillary endothelial cells in both gray matter of bovine brain and primary cultured BCEC. These data suggest that P-gp functions as a drug efflux pump at the luminal side of BCEC and regulates the transfer of certain lipophilic drugs from the blood into the brain.

AU: TAKAHASHI, K; ANDO, K; ONO, A; SHIMOSAWA, T; OGATA, E; FUJITA, T

TI: TUMOR-NECROSIS-FACTOR-ALPHA INDUCES VASCULAR HYPORESPONSIVENESS IN SPRAGUE-DAWLEY RATS
ID: RECOMBINANT HUMAN CACHECTIN; SEPTIC SHOCK; ENDOTHELIAL-CELLS; SMOOTH-MUSCLE; NITRIC-OXIDE; INTERLEUKIN-1; ENDOTOXIN; ASSOCIATION; AORTA; HYPOTENSION
AB: The cytokine tumor necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-alpha) is one of the major mediators of septic shock. Because vasodilation is a hallmark of sepsis and decreased vascular responsiveness has been implicated in the pathogenesis of septic shock, we studied the effect of TNF-alpha on the mean blood pressure in conscious rats and vascular responsiveness to vasoconstrictors ex vivo using the standard organ bath method. Intravenous infusion of TNF-alpha (0.006 or 0.06 mg/kg/hr for 10 hours) decreased mean blood pressure in a dose-dependent fashion. Contractile responses to norepinephrine were depressed dose-dependently in the aortic rings both with and without its endothelium. Aortic contractions by potassium depolarization were also depressed. These results suggest that TNF-alpha induces non-specific vascular hyporesponsiveness, which is independent of the presence of the endothelium. The TNF-alpha-induced vascular hyporesponsiveness might contribute to the hypotensive action of TNF-alpha.

ID: CHEMICAL-SHIFTS; CARBON-COMPOUNDS; SUBSTITUENT; FLUORIDES; SYSTEMS
AB: The C-13 and F-19 (when appropriate) chemical shifts of a variety of di-, tri- and tetrasubstituted methanes of the type CH2XCOOEt (I), CHXYCOOEt (II) and CXYZCOOEt (III), where the substituents X, Y and Z are F, Br, OEt, OPh, SEt, SPh and NO2, were determined. The prediction of the observed C-alpha-chemical shifts of I, II and III based on the simple additivity of substituent effects in monosubstituted methanes [MeX; SCS(IV)] is not satisfactory, although those of I are well correlated with SCS (IV). The C-alpha-chemical shifts of II and III can be correlated in terms of the multi-parameter analysis of individual SCS (I), the difference between delta (CH2XCOOEt) and delta (CH3COOEt). The origin of the chemical shifts is discussed. The F-19 chemical shifts of I, II and III were also satisfactorily analysed in terms of sigma(I) and sigma(R)0.

AU: HAN, MS; FURUYA, K; NEMOTO, T
AF: HAN, MS; FURUYA, K; NEMOTO, T
TI: SPECIES-SPECIFIC PRODUCTIVITY OF SKELETONEMA-COSTATUM (BACILLARIOPHYCEAE) IN THE INNER PART OF TOKYO BAY
ID: RATES
AB: The composition of red tides in Tokyo Bay varied with season; those during summer 1986 and 1987 were comprised almost entirely of Skeletonema costatum. Primary productivity by S. costatum ranged from 5.2 to 70.4% of total productivity; on an annual basis, its contribution was 18.8%, as revealed by species-specific photosynthetic rate (SSP), determined by the micromanipulation of C-14-labeled cells under simulated in situ conditions. SSP of S. costatum normalized with cell volume, an indicator of growth activity, showed temporal variations as the species composition of the red tides changed. The volume-specific SSP was high in the initial phase of the bloom, then decreased gradually with cell division, and reached a minimum at the peak of the bloom. However, the high volume-specific SSP was rather short-lived.

AF: TOKUYAMA, H; KURAMOTO, S; SOH, W; MIYASHITA, S; BYRNE, T; TANAKA, T
TI: INITIATION OF OPHIOLITE EMPLACEMENT - A MODERN EXAMPLE FROM OKUSHIRI RIDGE, NORTHEAST JAPAN ARC
ID: VOLCANIC-ROCKS; SEA
AB: Submersible dives by Shinkai 2000 discovered thickly piled back-arc basin basalts and an overlying sequence of siliceous hemipelagites and turbidites on the western fault escarpment of the Okushiri Ridge, off western Hokkaido. The Okushiri Ridge is an allochthonous tectonic block marked by an east-dipping main boundary thrust and a west-dipping back thrust. The block is interpreted to have formed as a result of the plate convergence between the Northeast Japan and Eurasian plates and all available data, including seismic profiles and geochemical analyses, suggest that the Okushiri Ridge constitutes a piece of oceanic crust of the Japan Basin. Ultimately, this piece of oceanic crust will be incorporated into the Japan magmatic arc. The Okushiri Ridge therefore demonstrates that tectonic inversion, i.e. the change from extension to compression, plays an important role in ophiolite emplacement.

AU: KOBAYASHI, T
AF: KOBAYASHI, T
TI: SINGULAR UNITARY REPRESENTATIONS AND DISCRETE-SERIES FOR INDEFINITE STIEFEL MANIFOLDS U(P,Q-F)/U(P-M,Q-F)
SO: MEMOIRS OF THE AMERICAN MATHEMATICAL SOCIETY
DE: UNITARY REPRESENTATIONS OF SEMISIMPLE LIE GROUPS; ZUCKERMAN DERIVED FUNCTOR MODULES; DISCRETE SERIES; SYMMETRICAL SPACES; PSEUDO-ORTHOGONAL GROUPS
ID: SEMISIMPLE LIE-GROUPS; SYMMETRIC-SPACES; DIMENSIONAL REPRESENTATIONS; CONJUGACY CLASSES; FUNCTOR MODULES; DUALITY; THEOREM; FINITE
AB: This paper treats the relatively singular part of the unitary dual of pseudo-orthogonal groups over F = R, C and H. These representations arise from discrete series for indefinite Stiefel manifolds U(p, q; F)/U(p - m, q; F) (2m less-than-or-equal-to p). Thanks to the duality theorem between D-module construction and Zuckerman's derived functor modules (ZDF-modules), these discrete series are naturally described in terms of ZDF-modules with possibly singular parameters. Some techniques including a new K-type formula are offered to find the explicit condition deciding whether the corresponding ZDF-modules R(q)S(C(lambda)) vanish or not. We also investigate the irreducibility and pairwise inequivalence among these ZDF-modules. Although our concern is limited to the discrete series, our approach is purely algebraic and applicable to a less special setting. It is an interesting phenomenon that our discrete series sometimes give a sharper condition for unitarizability of ZDF-modules than those given by Vogan (1984) algebraically. This phenomenon does not occur in the case of discrete series for group manifolds or semisimple symmetric spaces.

AF: HAGA, T; KOMASE, K; YOSHIKAWA, Y; YAMANOUCHI, K
TI: MOLECULAR ANALYSIS OF VIRUS-PRODUCING AND NONPRODUCING CLONES DERIVED FROM A DEFECTIVE SSPE VIRUS YAMAGATA-1 STRAIN
ID: SUBACUTE SCLEROSING PANENCEPHALITIS; MEASLES-VIRUS; BIASED HYPERMUTATION; MATRIX PROTEIN; CELLS; GENE; RNA
AB: Two virus clones were isolated from a defective SSPE virus, the Yamagata-1 strain, and designated as the YA and YF clones. The YA clone-infected cells produced neither cell-free virus nor cell-associated virus, whereas the YF clone-infected cells produced both cell-associated and cell-free virus. No difference of epitopes on structural proteins was observed between these two clones. Both clones had hemadsorption activity. Quantitation of structural protein by Western dot blots showed relatively a lower amount of M protein in the YA-infected cells than that in the YF-infected cells. The ratio, P plus M dicistronic/M monocistronic mRNA, in the YA-infected cells was about twice that in the YF-infected cells. Sequence analysis of cDNA corresponding to P plus M dicistronic mRNA revealed that the deduced M protein of the YF virus was smaller than that of the YA virus by five amino acids from the carboxy terminal. These results suggest that abundant production of P plus M dicistronic mRNA is responsible for the reduced amount of M protein in the non-productive YA clone.

TI: RECOGNITION OF THE SELF IDIOTYPE BY T-CELLS - INDUCTION OF A RAPID INCREASE IN CYTOPLASMIC FREE CALCIUM IN T-CELLS RECOGNIZING A VARIABLE L-CHAIN DETERMINANT
ID: MAJOR HISTOCOMPATIBILITY COMPLEX; MOUSE MYELOMA PROTEIN; ANTIGEN PRESENTATION; IMMUNE-RESPONSES; LYMPHOCYTES-B; ACTIVATION; IMMUNOGLOBULIN; REQUIREMENTS; CONFORMATION; EXPRESSION
AB: To investigate the initial stages of recognition of the self idiotype (Id) by T cells, we examined the early increase in cytoplasmic free calcium ([Ca2+]i) occurring in murine CD4+ T cells specific for a model Id, Id315, following their interaction with the Id. The changes in [Ca2+]i were monitored with stopped-flow fluorometry by loading T cells with fura 2, a Ca2+-binding fluorescent dye. An increase of [Ca2+]i in the Id-specific T cell line was dependent on the presence of both antigen-presenting cells(APC) and Id315. When T cells were mixed with APC pulsed with M315 for 90 min at 37 C, a significant increase in T cell [Ca2+]i was observed within one second. A pronounced elevation in [Ca2+]i was also observed in T cells after their interaction with APC which had been pulsed for 90 min with V(L)-315 Id-containing proteins (such as V(L)-315, L315, Fv-315 or Fab'-315 fragments). In contrast, pulsing APC for 5 min with the V(L) fragment produced little or no change in the [Ca2+]i. These results suggest that V(L) must be further processed by APC before it can be recognized by T cells. Indeed, a synthetic V(L) region peptide (positions 91-108, designated as P18) produced an elevation in T cell [Ca2+]i when mixed with APC without pulsing.

AU: HIRAMATSU, K; KIHARA, H; YOKOTA, T
AF: HIRAMATSU, K; KIHARA, H; YOKOTA, T
TI: ANALYSIS OF BORDERLINE-RESISTANT STRAINS OF METHICILLIN-RESISTANT STAPHYLOCOCCUS-AUREUS USING POLYMERASE CHAIN-REACTION
ID: PENICILLIN-BINDING PROTEIN; BETA-LACTAM ANTIBIOTICS; MOLECULAR-CLONING; MECA GENE; AFFINITY
AB: Identification of methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus by drug-susceptibility tests alone poses a serious problem, because a considerable number of clinical S. aureus isolates are borderline resistant to methicillin. To circumvent this problem, we have developed a quick and sensitive method of PCR amplification for the detection of mecA gene, which, coding for PBP2', is the specific genetic element of methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus. This method made it possible to identify MRSA strains in a short time using as few as 30 cells as a starting material for template DNA. Using this method, we found that the strains of borderline methicillin-resistance could be accurately identified. We also found one S. aureus clinical strain, T3, which lacked mecA gene in spite of its resistance to methicillin.

TI: NUCLEOTIDE-SEQUENCE OF THE ARGININE DEIMINASE GENE OF MYCOPLASMA-HOMINIS
ID: CLONING; DNA
AB: The arginine deiminase gene of Mycoplasma hominis was amplified by the polymerase chain reaction, and its entire nucleotide sequence was determined. This gene consists of 1227 base pairs encoding 409 amino acids, and has 35.2% guanine plus cytosine content. Nucleotide sequence homologies of the arginine deiminase gene between M. hominis and M. arginini, and between M. hominis and M. orale were 82.1 and 80.8%, respectively, suggesting that this gene is highly conserved among arginine-utilizing Mycoplasma species.

TI: PROPOSAL OF BURKHOLDERIA GEN-NOV AND TRANSFER OF 7 SPECIES OF THE GENUS PSEUDOMONAS HOMOLOGY GROUP-II TO THE NEW GENUS, WITH THE TYPE SPECIES BURKHOLDERIA-CEPACIA (PALLERONI AND HOLMES 1981) COMB-NOV
ID: FATTY-ACIDS; POLAR LIPIDS; SOLANACEARUM; COMAMONAS; PICKETTII; REV; DNA
AB: Based on the 16S rRNA sequences, DNA-DNA homology values. cellular lipid and fatty acid composition, and phenotypic characteristics, a new genus Burkholderia is proposed for the RNA homology group II of genus Pseudomonas. Seven species in this group were transfered to the new genus. Thus seven new combinations, Burkholderia cepacia (Palleroni and Holmes 1981), Burkholderia mallei (Zopf 1885), Burkholderia pseudomallei (Whitmore 1913), Burkholderia caryophylli (Burkholder 1942), Burkholderia gladioli (Severini 1913), Burkholderia pickettii (Ralston et al 1973) and Burkholderia solanacearum (Smith 1896) were proposed.

AU: FUKUOKA, S; KAMISHIMA, H; TAMIYA, E; KARUBE, I
AF: FUKUOKA, S; KAMISHIMA, H; TAMIYA, E; KARUBE, I
TI: SPONTANEOUS RELEASE OF OUTER-MEMBRANE VESICLES BY ERWINIA-CAROTOVORA
ID: CELL-WALL; LIPOPOLYSACCHARIDES; ACID; ENDOTOXIN; NEISSERIA
AB: The spontaneous release of vesicles by Erwinia carotovora FERM P-7576 was examined by electron microscopy and chemical analyses. A negatively stained preparation revealed that the vesicles were released as outer membrane fragments, The outer membrane contained lipopolysaccharide (LPS). The fatty acid components of the bacterial cells, vesicles and LPS were characterized. The cells contained cis-9-hexadecenoic and cis-11 -octadecenoic acids as unsaturated fatty acids. The cellular LPS and the extracellular LPS isolated from the vesicles were compared with respect to fatty acid and carbohydrate compositions. Both LPSs contained identical amounts of 3-hydroxytetradecanoic and dodecanoic acids with small amounts of tetradecanoic and hexadecanoic acids. The carbohydrate composition was galactose, glucose, and L-glycero-D-mannoheptose as neutral sugars as well as glucosamine (molar ratio 1:1:3:2). The LPS specific constituent heptose was the most abundant component. The vesicles were therefore composed of unmodified outer membrane.

AU: SHIDA, S

TI: UTILIZATION AND EVALUATION OF EXTERIOR WOOD .3. 2-DIMENSIONAL DIFFERENCE CALCULUS ANALYSIS OF A WOODEN DECKS HEAT-TRANSFER UNDER SOLAR-RADIATION
DE: HEAT TRANSFER; WOODEN DECK; DIFFERENCE CALCULUS; SOLAR RADIATION; HEAT RESERVE
AB: The thermal performances of deck members which were exposed to solar radiation were examined. The two-dimensional difference calculus was conducted in analising the daily variations of temperatures in the cross-sections of deck members that were assumed to be influenced mainly by the daily variations of both the sol-air temperature and the air temperature. Surface temperetures, temperature gradients and heat reserves of several materials were estimated by the difference calculus. The values of wood members were compared with the those of other materials. The main results obtained were as follows: 1) Two-dimensional difference calculus was proposed to analize the daily variations of temperature of the wooden deck exposed to solar radiation using the sol-air temperature and air temperature as the main factors. 2) Surface temperature of the wooden deck was estimated to be greater than that of a concrete deck under the same conditions. 3) Curved shape of the temperture gradient of the wooden deck in the thickness direction showed that the gradient was large near the surface exposed to solar radiation and was small near the dack surface. The temperature gradient of the wood deck was estimated to be larger than that of the concrete deck. 4) Heat reserves of the wood deck were estimated as less or equal to half of that of concrete deck because of the former's small heat capacity.

PA: 1-1-17, MUKOGAOKA, BUNKYO-KU, TOKYO, 113-0023, JAPAN

AU: OHI, H; MESHITSUKA, G; ISHIZU, A
AF: OHI, H; MESHITSUKA, G; ISHIZU, A
TI: A NEW METHOD TO EVALUATE DELIGNIFICATION SELECTIVITY AND ITS APPLICATION TO ALKALINE SULFITE-QUINONE COOKING
DE: DELIGNIFICATION SELECTIVITY; ALKALINE SULFITE; QUINONE COOKING; PICEA-JEZOENSIS; FAGUS-CRENATA
AB: A new method is proposed to evaluate delignification selectivity during various wood cooking processes. By this method, rates of delignification and lessening of carbohydrate yields, which are independently given, are used for the simulation of delignification selectivity at given delignification rates, and to determine carbohydrate yields during various cooking processes, which are compared with each other. This method was applied to the comparison of delignification selectivity of alkaline sulfite-quinone cooking and soda-quinone cooking. Delignification selectivity for Picea jezoensis Carr. during alkaline sulfite-quinone cooking was better than that during soda-quinone cooking. That is, the carbohydrate yield of the former was 1.5-2.0% higher at a given delignification. For Fagus crenata Bl., although that during the former was slightly better, the increase of the carbohydrate yield was smaller than in the case of P. jezoensis.

AU: WATANABE, M; MESHITSUKA, G; ISHIZU, A
AF: WATANABE, M; MESHITSUKA, G; ISHIZU, A
TI: RADICAL SULFONATION OF LIGNIN .3. APPLICATION TO VARIOUS LIGNINS
DE: RADICAL SULFONATION; WATER SOLUBLE LIGNIN; MOLECULAR OXYGEN; SODIUM SULFITE; DISPERSING AGENT
ID: LIQUID-CHROMATOGRAPHY
AB: Radical sulfonation, using molecular oxygen as an oxidant, was applied to various lignins. Large differences in the yields of water-soluble lignins and sodium sulfite consumptions between lignins were observed. These differences were obviously due to the structural characteristics of lignins, especially those of side chains. The most reactive lignin to radical sulfonation was birch acid hydrolysis lignin, although it is believed to be less reactive for the normal chemical reactions. Lignin model compounds also showed the profound effect of the side chain structures on their reactivities to radical sulfonation. The reactivity seems to be eventually governed by the electron density of aromatic nucleus. Many sulfonated compounds were obtained from the radical sulfonation treatment of ethylguaiacol. The reaction mechanism dose not seem to be simple, and not only a phenoxyl radical but also a benzyl radical and some other radicals may be involved in the reaction.

AU: TSUCHIMOTO, T; NAKAMURA, N; ARIMA, T
AF: TSUCHIMOTO, T; NAKAMURA, N; ARIMA, T
TI: ANALYSIS OF THE CHARACTERISTIC FREQUENCIES OF CONNECTIONS IN TIMBER STRUCTURES BY THE NUMERAL SOLUTION OF THE EIGENVALUE
DE: CHARACTERISTIC FREQUENCY; EIGENVALUE; JACOBI THEOREM; SEMIRIGID BEHAVIOR; DYNAMIC PERFORMANCE
AB: With the following analysis method developed, the characteristic frequencies for variable connections in timber structures are analyzed. 1) Considering the semi-rigid behavior of T-type model of connections on the multi-degree-of-freedom system, a stiffness matrix and a mass matrix are constructed. 2) The equations of motion of an undamped system is solved numerally as an eigenvalue problem applying Jacobi's theorem. 3) The characteristic frequencies of connections are calculated from analyzed eigenvalues, and the characteristic frequency calculated by this method, are compared with the experimental characteristic frequencies of the free oscillation test. As a result, the characteristic frequencies calculated as a cantilever and the experimental values are not in a distinct correlation. On the other hand, the calculated values of this method and the experimental values have a significant correlation. These results suggest that this methods effective in analyzing the dynamic performance and the oscillating state of connections with little rotational resistance by the timber structure, and further move in analyzing the entire timber structure with such connections dynamically.
RP: TSUCHIMOTO, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO, FAC AGR, TOKYO 113, JAPAN.
PA: 1-1-17, MUKOGAOKA, BUNKYO-KU, TOKYO, 113-0023, JAPAN

AU: ANDO, K; SATO, K; FUSHITANI, M
AF: ANDO, K; SATO, K; FUSHITANI, M
TI: FRACTURE-TOUGHNESS AND ACOUSTIC-EMISSION CHARACTERISTICS OF WOOD .2. EFFECTS OF GRAIN ANGLE
DE: ACOUSTIC EMISSION; FRACTURE TOUGHNESS; GRAIN ANGLE; CRACK INITIATION; FRACTOGRAPHY
AB: The effects of grain angle on the fracture toughness, acoustic emission (AE) characteristics, and fractographic features of crack initiation in wood were examined. Single edge-notched specimens of ezomatsu (Picea jezoensis Carr.) were employed for the experiment. Tension tests were made under AE monitoring. Specimens with the following grain angles, theta (the angle between the direction of load and grain), were prepared : 0-degrees, 15-degrees, 30-degrees, 45-degrees, 60-degrees, 75-degrees, and 90-degrees. The notchs always were introduced in the tangential direction. The results are summerized as follows: 1) The critical stress-intensity factor (K(IC)), which was calculated from a load at crack initiation, decreased with increasing grain angles. 2) The transition of the AE cumulative event-count up to a load at crack initiation varied according to the grain angles. With increasing grain-angles, AE waves tended to be generated rapidly. 3) There were remarkable differences in the AE amplitude distributions up to the load at crack initiation between the small grain-angles (theta=0-degrees and 15-degrees) and the large grain-angles (theta greater-than-or-equal-to 30-degrees). For small grain-angles, only signals of low amplitude (40-50 dB) were generated in the early stage. As load increased, signals of higher amplitudes gradually were generated. On the other hand, for large grain-angles, signals of the higher amplitudes (65 -75 dB) were generated from the early stage onward. 4) The fractographic features of crack initiation were observed with a scanning electron microscope. There were remarkable differences in the features of early wood. At the small grain-angles, the initial crack propagated along the grain with the cutting of cell walls transversely and in the tangential direction by one or a few cell diameters. At the large grain-angles, the initial crack propagated almost directly along the grain from the initial crack tip. 5) From a comparison of the AE data with the observations of crack initiation, we think that at the small grain-angles, before the expansion of the initial crack, the separations of the boundaries of the cells, or the opening of micro cracks included originally in the wood, had occurred at the forward portion at the intial crack tip.

AU: NAKAJIMA, S; ARIMA, T
AF: NAKAJIMA, S; ARIMA, T
TI: VIBRATING MECHANISM OF A WOODEN STRUCTURE .3. VIBRATING PROPERTIES AND ANALYSIS OF A WOODEN-FRAME MODEL STRUCTURE WITH SEMIRIGID JOINTS
DE: WOODEN-FRAME STRUCTURE; DYNAMIC PROPERTY; SEMIRIGID JOINT; FINITE ELEMENT METHOD; EIGENVALUE ANALYSIS
AB: Quarter size, semi-rigid jointed frame structures with various types of horizontal planes were constructed and subjected to vibration tests to clarify the effects of their shear rigidities of their horizontal planes on the dynamic properties of the entire structures. The testing structures were modeled as three-dimensional frames with semi-rigid joints, and structural analyses by the finite element method was conducted. The results are summarized as follows: (1) These structures had four resonant points which were responsible for the parallel and torsional vibrations of the structures and the shearing vibrations of the horizontal planes. (2) The natural frequencies responsible for the vibrations of the horizontal planes had positive correlations with the shearing resistances of the horizontal planes. However, the natural frequencies responsible for the parallel and torsional vibrations of the structures were not influenced by the shearing resistances of the horizontal planes. (3) The experimental moduli of torsional limpnesses of the joints generally decreased as the rigidities of the joints increased, and they increased as the angles of torsion increased. (4) The natural frequencies and the mode shapes of the tested structures were estimated adequately by modeling the structures as three-dimensional frames with semi-rigid joints, and by performing eigenvalue analyses.
RP: NAKAJIMA, S (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO, FAC AGR, TOKYO 113, JAPAN.
CR: PAZ M, 1989, MICROCOMPUTER AIDED, P171; SUGIYAMA H, 1988 P INT C TIMB EN, V2, P55

AU: ISOGAI, A; USUDA, M
AF: ISOGAI, A; USUDA, M
TI: X-RAY-DIFFRACTION AND SOLID-STATE C-13-NMR ANALYSES OF CELLULOSES TREATED WITH AMMONIA
DE: CELLULOSE; CELLULOSE-III; LIQUID AMMONIA; X-RAY; C-13-NMR
ID: VALONIA; TRANSFORMATION; POLYMORPHS
AB: Cellulose samples, which had cellulose I, II, and amorphous structures, were treated with liquid ammonia at -33-degrees-C under an atomospheric pressure or at 140-degrees-C (critical point of NH3 = 132-degrees-C) under a high pressure, and their crystallinities and crystal structures were studied by X-ray diffraction and solid-state C-13-NMR analyses. Crystallinity of cellulose III was low when the original samples were treated at -33-degrees-C, and some of the treated samples had disordered structures. On the other hand, highly crystalline cellulose III samples were obtained when the original samples were treated at 140-degrees-C. Cellulose samples with the higher crystallinities of cellulose I or II gave the higher crystallinity of cellulose III by the ammonia treatments. Solid-state C-13-NMR spectra showed that C4 and C6 resonances originating from cellulose I or II disappeared with the ammonia treatment at -33-degrees-C, and that the crystallinity of cellulose III was increased with shifting of the C4 resonance from 84 to 88 ppm by the ammonia treatment at 140-degrees-C. On the basis of these results, the mechanism of the formation of cellulose III by the ammonia treatment is discussed.

AU: ISOGAI, A; USUDA, M
AF: ISOGAI, A; USUDA, M
TI: X-RAY-DIFFRACTION AND SOLID-STATE C-13-NMR ANALYSES OF WOOD CELLULOSES TREATED WITH AMMONIA
DE: WOOD; HOLOCELLULOSE; CELLULOSE-III; AMMONIA; X-RAY; C-13-NMR; LIGNIN
AB: Wood meal, holocellulose, and bleached kraft pulp were treated with ammonia at 140-degrees-C under high pressure. The crysteal structures of the products were studied by X-ray diffraction and solid-state C-13-NMR analyses. X-ray diffraction patterns of the products showed that cellulose III was formed in all samples. The decreasing order of crystallinities of cellulose III was as follows for original samples: holocellulose equal-to-or-greater-than bleached kraft pulp > wood meal. Thus, the presence of lignin slightly prevented the crystallization, whereas that of hemicellulose promoted the crystallization to cellulose III. Solid-state C-13-NMR spectra of the products revealed that the chemical shift due to C6 of cellulose I disappeared with the ammonia treatment. Thus, ammonia molecules broke open most of the cellulose I lattices in the samples, resulting in the destruction of the structure of cellulose I. Hemicellulose present in holocellulose gave the pattern of a solid-state C-13-NMR spectrum similar to that of cellulose III after the ammonia treatment.
RP: ISOGAI, A (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO, FAC AGR, TOKYO 113, JAPAN.

AU: NANAMI, N; NAKAMURA, N; ARIMA, T; OKUMA, M
AF: NANAMI, N; NAKAMURA, N; ARIMA, T; OKUMA, M
TI: MEASURING THE PROPERTIES OF STANDING TREES WITH STRESS WAVES .1. THE METHOD OF MEASUREMENT AND THE PROPAGATION PATH OF THE WAVES
DE: STRESS WAVES; PROPAGATION PATH; TIME DIFFERENCE; LOGS; REPRODUCIBILITY
AB: The method of measuring the properties of wood with propagation velocities of impact stress waves was investigated. For this purpose, the time differnces (DELTAT) between two wave-shapes detected by accelerometers attached to logs of sugi (Cryptomeria japonica D. Don) were measured. Reproducibilities in measuring DELTAT and the effects of the propagation path of stress waves on DELTAT were studied. The results are summarized as follows: (1) Reproducibilities in measuring DELTAT were improved by hitting the heads of nails being driven into the specimens and reading the DELTAT between the rising edges of two wave-shapes. (2) The measured DELTAT showed the properties of the specimens between the measuring points. (3) The measured DELTAT was affected by the propagation path of the stress waves. Propagating in the L-direction, the stress waves traveled on the surface of the log. Propagating in the R and theta-directions, the waves traveled in the longitudinal section containing pith. The waves were propagated in straight lines in the L and R-directions. On the assumption that the waves were propagated in a straight line in the theta-direction, the value of the calculated DELTAT was similar to that of the measured DELTAT. Theta was the angle between the longitudinal axis of the log and the line from the impact point to the attached accelerometer. According to these facts, the method of measuring DELTAT as described above can be applied to logs with large cross-sections.
RP: NANAMI, N (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO, FAC AGR, TOKYO 113, JAPAN.
CR: Bucur V., 1985, Ultrasonics, P269; GERHARDS CC, 1982, FOREST PROD J, V32, P20; ROSS RJ, 1988, FOREST PROD J, V38, P39
PA: 1-1-17, MUKOGAOKA, BUNKYO-KU, TOKYO, 113-0023, JAPAN

AU: NANAMI, N; NAKAMURA, N; ARIMA, T; OKUMA, M
AF: NANAMI, N; NAKAMURA, N; ARIMA, T; OKUMA, M
TI: MEASURING THE PROPERTIES OF STANDING TREES WITH STRESS WAVES .2. APPLICATION OF THE METHOD TO STANDING TREES
DE: STANDING TREES; STRESS WAVES; PROPAGATION VELOCITY; PROPAGATION TIME; MOISTURE CONTENT
AB: The method of measuring the properties of wood with propagation velocities of impact stress waves was applied to standing trees. For this purpose, the effects of the dead weights on the propagation times (DELTAT) or the propagation velocities (v) of stress waves in logs of sugi (Cryptomeria japonica D. Don) and of moisture contents (MC) on DELTAT or v in small specimens of sugi were investigated. The DELTAT or v in standing trees were measured on sites. The results are summarized as follows: (1) DELTAT or v in the L, R, and 0-directions could be measured directly by a hammer with an accelerometer. 0 was the angle between the longitudinal axis of the log or standing tree and the line from the impact point to the attached accelerometer. (2) The measured DELTATs were not affected by the dead weights of standing trees. (3) The rate of the decrease of the measured v was not much in the range of high MCs over fiber saturation point. (4) DELTAT and v of standing trees were the same as those of logs of the same MC. According to these facts, the method of measuring the DELTAT of stress waves is feasible in the evaluation of the properties of standing trees.

AU: YOSHIHARA, H; OHTA, M
AF: YOSHIHARA, H; OHTA, M
TI: STRESS-STRAIN RELATIONSHIP OF WOOD IN THE PLASTIC REGION .1. EXAMINATION OF THE APPLICABILITY OF PLASTICITY THEORIES
DE: UNIAXIAL-COMPRESSION TEST; GRAIN ORIENTATION; PLASTICITY THEORY; EQUIVALENT STRESS; EQUIVALENT PLASTIC STRAIN
AB: The stress-strain relationship of wood in the plastic region was examined on the basis of plasticity theories. Uniaxial-compression tests of agathis (Agathis sp.) and katsura (Cercidiphyllum japonicum Sieb. and Zucc.) with various grain orientations were made, and the stress (sigma(u))-plastic strain (epsilon(u)p) relationship corresponding to each grain orientation (phi) was obtained. The equivalent stress (sigmaBAR) equivalent plastic strain (epsilon(p)BAR) relationship, which is, according to the plasticity theory, independent of the stress state, was given by the transformation of the sigma(u)-epsilon(u)p relationship for each grain orientation. Then, it was studied whether or not this sigmaBAR-epsilon(p)BAR relationship could be described independently of the grain orientation. All of the sigmaBAR-epsilon(p)BAR curves did not agree completely because of the difficulty in obtaining the sigma(u)-epsilon(u)p relationships of off-axis specimens properly. However, the sigmaBAR-epsilon(p)BAR curves were close, and they overlapped under some test conditions, although the sigma(u)BAR-epsilon(u)p curves corresponding to the grain angles were separated from each other and had different shapes. Thus, we think that the sigmaBAR-epsilon(p)BAR curves had no dependence on the grain orientations. From the experimental results given above, we concluded that the equivalent stress-equivalent plastic strain relationships transformed from stress-plastic strain relationships are independent of the stress states, and that the plasticity theories are applicable in analyzing the stress-strain relationships of wood in plastic regions.
RP: YOSHIHARA, H (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO, FAC AGR, BUNKYO KU, TOKYO 113, JAPAN.

AU: SHIDA, S; ONO, H; MIKAMI, T; TAKAHASHI, H
AF: SHIDA, S; ONO, H; MIKAMI, T; TAKAHASHI, H
TI: UTILIZATION AND EVALUATION OF EXTERIOR WOOD .4. SLIPPERINESS OF WOOD DECKS FOR FLOATING PIERS
DE: SLIPPERINESS; COEFFICIENT OF SLIP-RESISTANCE; FLOATING PIERS; WOODEN DECKS; EXTERIOR WOOD
AB: The lumber have very often been used empirically for the deck members such as the floating piers because its sensory taste is preffered by users (Fig. 1). Slipperiness of decks is one of the important performances for floor of floating piers from viewpoint of either safety or comfort. In the present paper, we have tried to measure a coefficient of slip resistance (C.S.R.), and to estimate the performance of slipperiness of wood decks by a sensory scale. Results are summarized as follows: (1) Regarding the slipperiness, all samples were more slippery at wet condition than at dry condition (Figs. 4 and 8). But they were permissible as the decks of floating piers from viewpoint of either safety and comfort (Tables 1 and 2). (2) Surface grooving or scorching treatment in order to control the slipperiness were effective at the wet condition (Figs. 5 and 6). Each C.S.R. value was in a permissible range on both the safety scale and the comfort scale. A formed plastics, of which surface was overlayed by a grain like sand, showed the highest C.S.R. value, and was estimated as the least slippery material among the test samples (No. 13 in Table 1). (3) Difference of direction of load movement toward direction of fiber did not have clear influence on the slipperiness in the both dry and wet conditions (Fig. 7).

AU: SUEMATSU, A; OKUMA, M
AF: SUEMATSU, A; OKUMA, M
TI: MECHANISM OF LOW-DENSITY PARTICLEBOARD FORMATION .4. BENDING STRENGTH OF LOW-DENSITY PARTICLEBOARD
DE: LOW-DENSITY PARTICLEBOARD; MODULUS OF RUPTURE; MODULUS OF ELASTICITY; TENSILE STRENGTH
AB: Homogeneous low-density particleboards were produced using two species and two adhesives, a phenolic resin (PF) and an isocyanate compound resin (IC). Resin content level was 10% based on dry-wood weight. Overall board thickness was 15 mm with a target specific gravities (SG) from 0.30 0.60. The effects of resin types, particle species, and board SG on the modulus of rupture (MOR) and the modulus of elasiticity (MOE), and the reductions of MOR and MOE after vaccum-water-soaking (24 hrs) and drying (40-degrees-C, 48 hrs) treatments were investigated. Furthermore, the calculated values of MOE applied to the theory of strength of laminated-materials were compared with the measured values. Results obtained are summarized as follows: 1) MOR and MOE increased linearly with increase in the board SG. Bending properties of IC boards was greater than that of PF boards. In the case of the same adhesives, bending properties of hinoki (Chamaecyparis obtusa (S. and Z.) Endl.) boards showed greater than that of buna (Fagus crenata Bl.) boards. As to hinoki PF boards with SG of 0.50 and buna PF boards with SG of 0.60, they exceeded the minimum specified strength of Japanese Industrial Standard (JIS) A 5908 type 200, which indicates the possibility of using PF as a binder for low-density particleboard. 2) Calculated values of MOE applied to the theory of the strength of laminated-materials were in reasonable agreement with the measured MOE. As for the failure strength, the calculated values did not agree well with the measured value because of the failure occurred in the confined part. 3) Retentions of MOR and MOE after vaccum-water-soaking-drying treatments depended on resin types, regardless of particle species. It was estimated that the retentions after treatments were 90% for IC boards and 60 70% for PF boards of those before treatments. Maximum load and proportional limit load after treatments were almost the same as before treatment.

TI: SELECTIVE CLEAVAGE OF ETHER BONDS IN LIGNIN BY TRIMETHYLSILYL IODIDE .2. LOW-MOLECULAR-WEIGHT REACTION-PRODUCTS
DE: LIGNIN; ETHER BOND; ETHER CLEAVAGE; TRIMETHYLSILYL IODIDE; CONIFERYL ALCOHOL
ID: REAGENT
AB: Formation of coniferyl alcohol, dihydroconiferyl alcohol and 6 iodo-dihydroconiferyl alcohol were confirmed in the trimethylsilyl iodide treatment mixture of spruce periodate lignin. Formation of these monomeric compounds strongly support our earlier reaction mechanism proposed for the cleavage of beta-ether bonds in lignin, that is, iodination at alpha position of lignin side chain, removal of iodine atom as I2, and two electrons transfer to cleave a beta-ether bond in lignin.
